alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Coconino Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 18 at 1:45PM MST until June 19 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MST /NOON MDT/ TO 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ MONDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY, COCONINO PLATEAU, LITTLE COLORADO RIVER VALLEY, AND THE NAVAJO NATION... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MST /noon MDT/ to 8 PM MST /9 PM MDT/ Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Buffalo Pass, Camp Verde, Chinle, Chino Valley, Congress, Cottonwood, Dilkon, Eagar- Springerville, Ganado, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Paulden, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Saint Johns, Seligman, Shonto, Snowflake-Taylor, Tuba City, Valle, Window Rock, and Winslow. This includes portions of the Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest, Prescott National Forest, and Tonto National Forest. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid outdoor activities that can cause a spark near dry vegetation, such as yard work, target shooting, or campfires. Follow local fire restrictions. Check weather.gov/flagstaff for updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning.
